statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Frederick Scott had a career-high 25 points on Friday night and Rider led by double digits throughout the second half in a 96-77 win over Fairfield.
article.headline: Scott scores career-high 25, Rider beats Fairfield 96-77
article.linkText: Scott scores career-high 25, Rider beats Fairfield 96-77
article.story: LAWRENCEVILLE, N.J. -- Frederick Scott had a career-high 25 points on Friday night and Rider led by double digits throughout the second half in a 96-77 win over Fairfield. Scott made all three of his 3-point attempts in the first half while the Broncs (9-6, 2-1 Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference) led by as many as 17 and went into the intermission up 50-34. Scott grabbed eight rebounds, finished 5 of 7 from distance and made 8 of 11 overall from the field. Rider reached its largest lead at 72-48 before the Stags (6-8, 1-2) used a 14-2 run to get within 12 with 9:09 to play. The Broncs kept the lead between 12 and 21 from there. Stevie Jordan added 18 points, Dimencio Vaughn scored 14, and Anthony Durham and Jordan Allen chipped in 10 apiece for Rider. Tyler Nelson had 21 points and Jonathan Kasibabu scored 13 for Fairfield.
